title: Teddy Bear Doctor: A Let's Make & Play Book: Be a Vet & Fix the Boo-Boos of Your Favorite Stuffed Animals
features: Got a teddy bear with a tummy ache or a stuffed dinosaur with scraped knees? Never fear! This delightful activity-kit-in-a-book includes everything kids ages 3 to 8 need to set up an amazing vet clinic and enjoy hours of fun playing doctor. There are pop-out signs to mount in the waiting room; adorably illustrated prescription forms, exam checklists, and appointment reminders to fill out; a nurse's cap to punch out and assemble; four sheets of colorful stickers; and more! The book also offers 15 simple and fun DIY projects to make with common household items, including a thermometer made from a pencil, a lab coat made from an old t-shirt, and a hospital bed made from a cardboard box.
description: Review
Recommended by the 2015 Parents' Choice Award

“The craft ideas are so clever! I look forward to sharing it with my grandchildren.” — Martha Stewart   “A homemade thermometer, patient check-in forms—I am so impressed with the clever details, play prompts, and all the included templates and stickers. This book is guaranteed to get imaginations going.” — Mary Giles,
FamilyFun
magazine   “Great for any child with an imagination … [
Teddy Bear Doctor
] provides sticker band-aids and tutorials to make everything needed. A lot of fun and we highly recommend this one!” — Crafty Moms Share
From the Back Cover
Open Your Vet Practice!
Fill out official forms and checklists for your patient records!
Fill out official forms and checklists for your patient records!
Make a thermometer, syringe, stethoscope, and more for your Pet Vet Kit!
Make a thermometer, syringe, stethoscope, and more for your Pet Vet Kit!
Create a recovery room with cages to care for your fuzzy friends!
Create a recovery room with cages to care for your fuzzy friends!
About the Author
Deanna F. Cook is the award-winning author of cookbooks for kids, including the best-selling
Cooking Class
Baking Class
,and
Cooking Class Global Feast!
She served as the creative development director at
FamilyFun
magazine and has been an editor at Scholastic, Disney, and Kidstir.com. She lives in western Massachusetts and can be found online at deannafcook.com.
